newsitem.title: USA: CNB Bancshares Q1 nonperforming loans fall.
newsitem.headline: CNB Bancshares Q1 nonperforming loans fall.

text.p: CNB Bancshares Inc, reporting record first-quarter earnings, said its nonperforming loans to total loans were reduced to 0.84 percent at March 31 from 1.00 percent a year earlier.

Non-interest income of $12.8 million, excluding securities gains, was $808,000 lower than first-quarter 1996 when $2.6 million of mortgage loan securitization gains were recorded. Excluding the March 1996 securitization gain and securities gains, non-interest income rose $1.8 million, or 16 percent from the 1996 first quarter.
Total non-interest expense of $31.3 million was reduced by $796,000 from the 1996 first quarter, which included $2.3 million of one-time charges generally related to office closures.
For the first quarter, CNB's earnings rose to $0.58 per share from $0.50 a year earlier.
